title: Legendary Singer Says He Had To Cancel Performance At Trump Inauguration Ball
text:
Legendary Singer Says He Had To Cancel Performance At Trump Inauguration Ball "... I would hope there would be some understanding ..." by Charles Campbell January 13, 2017 at 6:11pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Paul Anka was slated to perform at President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration ball Jan. 20 but had to bow out, the legendary singer told TMZ Friday. 
Anka said he planned to perform a customized version of one of Trump’s favorite songs, My Way , while the president-elect danced with his wife, Melania. 
Although many artists are boycotting the event, Anka’s decision was not out of protest, he said. Advertisement - story continues below The Wall Street Journal Calls For FBI Director Comey To Step Down 
The 75-year-old musician, who says he is a longtime friend of Trump’s, told TMZ he has personal matters to attend to. 
“I’ve been in a custody battle for two years for my son Ethan,” Anka told TMZ. “We have a new schedule now, and I’m unable to do it.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Anka said that he had always been planning to perform “for the office and for our country.” 
“If I had done it, I would hope there would be some understanding for my motivation for it and judge me accordingly,” he said. 
When asked if his political views were in line with Trump’s, Anka responded, “You’ve got a better chance of getting a sunrise past a rooster on that one.” 
Many artists have said they wouldn’t play the inauguration because they oppose the president-elect. The Mormon Tabernacle Choir was signed up to perform, but one member left the group in protest . The Radio City Rockettes were also enlisted for the event, although several dancers were extremely upset. Advertisement - story continues below
